name: Aku Djinn
oracle_text: Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature each opponent controls.
flavor_text:
"Your arrogance amazes me, Kaervek. Did you not know the price you would pay?"
—Mangara

rulings.text: Only puts counters on creatures your opponents control, so in the Two-Headed Giant format, won’t put counters on your teammate’s creatures.

name: Anvil of Bogardan
oracle_text: Players have no maximum hand size.
At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player draws an additional card, then discards a card.

rulings.text: If the draw part of the effect is skipped due to a replacement effect, the discard part of the effect is not skipped.

If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Null Profusion (an enchantment that says your maximum hand size is two) onto the battlefield and then put Anvil of Bogardan onto the battlefield, you’ll have no maximum hand size. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be two.
The triggered ability is put onto the stack after you have already drawn your card for the turn.

If there are two Anvils on the battlefield, they trigger and resolve separately. This means that you first draw one card and discard one card, and then do it again. You do not draw two cards and then discard two cards.

name: Archangel
oracle_text: Flying, vigilance
flavor_text:
"My mother once told me angels sing their swords' names with each strike."
—Sisay, Captain of the Weatherlight

name: Army Ants
oracle_text: {T}, Sacrifice a land: Destroy target land.
flavor_text:
"Do not underestimate the power of many against one."
—Sidar Jabari

name: Betrayal
oracle_text: Enchant creature an opponent controls
Whenever enchanted creature becomes tapped, you draw a card.
flavor_text:
"Sometimes a burden can be borne only on the shoulders of a willing enemy."
—Suq'Ata aphorism

rulings.text: If it ever enchants a creature that isn’t controlled by an opponent of Betrayal’s controller, then it’s put into the graveyard as a State-Based Action.

name: Blanket of Night
oracle_text: Each land is a Swamp in addition to its other land types.
flavor_text:
"Kaervek imprisoned Mangara out of jealousy, but he taints Jamuraa simply out of spite."
—Asmira, Holy Avenger

rulings.text: The land can now be tapped for black mana in addition to any other abilities it already has. This works just as if the text “{T}: Add {B}” was added to each mana-producing land. In other words, the land can be tapped for its own ability _or_ it can be tapped for black mana. Not both.
Whether the land is a basic land or not is unchanged by this effect.
More than one Blanket of Night has no meaningful additional effect.
Anything which counts the number of Swamps on the battlefield will not double count an actual Swamp card while Blanket of Night is on the battlefield.
It can affect lands which do not produce mana.
The lands do not get the name “Swamp” in addition to their current name. This is a reversal of older rulings.
The ability is a land type change effect so it is ordered along with other land type change effects in the order they entered the battlefield.
If this effect is applied to a snow land, the land is now a snow Swamp and not just a regular Swamp.

name: Bogardan Phoenix
oracle_text: Flying
When Bogardan Phoenix dies, exile it if it had a death counter on it. Otherwise, return it to the battlefield under your control and put a death counter on it.

rulings.text: Errata streamlined the trigger and got rid of the replacement effect. In both cases, it will go to the graveyard. In one it will then come back onto the battlefield; in the other it will then be exiled.

name: Brass-Talon Chimera
oracle_text: First strike
Sacrifice Brass-Talon Chimera: Put a +2/+2 counter on target Chimera creature. It gains first strike. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

name: Breathstealer's Crypt
oracle_text: If a player would draw a card, instead they draw a card and reveal it. If it's a creature card, that player discards it unless they pay 3 life.
flavor_text:
"Far too many soldiers have died in their beds."
—Telim'Tor

name: Breezekeeper
oracle_text: Flying
Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
flavor_text:
"He blows a gust across the cliff to vanish in a breath of wind."
—"Song of the Wind Being"

name: Brood of Cockroaches
oracle_text: When Brood of Cockroaches is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, at the beginning of the next end step, you lose 1 life and return Brood of Cockroaches to your hand.
flavor_text:
"It's like waking on a bed of a thousand olives during an earthquake of subtle force."
—Afari, Tales

rulings.text: The loss of life is not optional.
The life loss and the return to hand both happen at the beginning of the end step as a single effect. It is not two separate effects.

name: Bull Elephant
oracle_text: When Bull Elephant enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return two Forests you control to their owner's hand.
flavor_text:
Four gray trees and a long, coiling snake. What am I?
—Zhalfirin riddle

name: Chronatog
oracle_text: {0}: Chronatog gets +3/+3 until end of turn. You skip your next turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
flavor_text: For the chronatog, there is no meal like the present.

rulings.text: You can only activate the ability once each turn for each Chronatog.

name: City of Solitude
oracle_text: Players can cast spells and activate abilities only during their own turns.
flavor_text:
"My horizon was the arcing petals, my new home resplendent with spires of weeds and pillows of fragrant pollen."
—Naimah, Femeref philosopher

rulings.text: City of Solitude can affect abilities of cards that are not on the battlefield because it prevents players from activating those abilities.
City of Solitude does not stop triggered abilities from being put on the stack. They are never “activated”.
This stops players from activating mana abilities.

name: Cloud Elemental
oracle_text: Flying
Cloud Elemental can block only creatures with flying.
flavor_text:
"You know you've angered the gods when the clouds turn against you."
—Sisay, Captain of the Weatherlight

name: Coercion
oracle_text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
flavor_text:
A rhino's bargain
—Femeref expression meaning "a situation with no choices"

name: Coral Atoll
oracle_text: Coral Atoll enters the battlefield tapped.
When Coral Atoll enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return an untapped Island you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {C}{U}.

rulings.text: This has a triggered ability when it enters the battlefield, not a replacement effect, as previously worded.

name: Corrosion
oracle_text: Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)

At the beginning of your upkeep, put a rust counter on each artifact target opponent controls. Then destroy each artifact with converted mana cost less than or equal to the number of rust counters on it. Artifacts destroyed this way can't be regenerated.
When Corrosion leaves the battlefield, remove all rust counters from all permanents.

rulings.text: It does count rust counters put on artifacts by other Corrosion cards. This means that having more than one of these can result in fast destruction of artifacts.
In multiplayer games, you can choose a new target player each upkeep.

Only puts rust counters on artifacts your opponents control, but destroys all artifacts with rust counters on them, even your own. When it leaves the battlefield, it removes all rust counters, not just those that happen to be on artifacts.

name: Creeping Mold
oracle_text: Destroy target artifact, enchantment, or land.
flavor_text:
"Mold could catch you."
—Suq'Ata insult

name: Crypt Rats
oracle_text: {X}: Crypt Rats deals X damage to each creature and each player. Spend only black mana on X.
flavor_text:
"Once I dreamt of death, but now it dreams of me / And only rats and rotting flesh can hear my silent plea."
—Mundungu chant

name: Daraja Griffin
oracle_text: Flying
Sacrifice Daraja Griffin: Destroy target black creature.
flavor_text: "And the flamingos said, ‘Get out of our nest—we can't be seen with the likes of you!' So, the griffin ate them."—Azeworai, "The Ugly Bird"

name: Dark Privilege
oracle_text: Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate enchanted creature.
flavor_text:
"As you breathe your last, understand why I accept such forbidden gifts."
—Purraj of Urborg

name: Death Watch
oracle_text: Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, its controller loses life equal to its power and you gain life equal to its toughness.
flavor_text:
"Watch death wait / Wait, death, watch / Steal breath swiftly / but steal life slowly."
—Suq'Ata dirge

name: Desertion
oracle_text: Counter target spell. If an artifact or creature spell is countered this way, put that card onto the battlefield under your control instead of into its owner's graveyard.
flavor_text: First the insult, then the injury.

rulings.text: The card is put onto the battlefield, but any effects that check if the original card was “cast from your hand” will not trigger or otherwise consider the card to have been cast from your hand. The card was put onto the battlefield by the effect of Desertion instead.
This spell includes a replacement effect. If the target is an artifact or creature, it never goes to the graveyard.
If the spell is not countered (because the spell it targets can’t be countered), then this card’s ability does not put the card onto the battlefield. The spell continues to resolve as normal.

name: Desolation
oracle_text: At the beginning of each end step, each player who tapped a land for mana this turn sacrifices a land. Desolation deals 2 damage to each player who sacrificed a Plains this way.
flavor_text:
"Kill a creature, destroy the present. Kill the land, destroy the future."
—Kaervek

rulings.text: It works even if it was not on the battlefield when the land was tapped for mana.
Each Desolation only causes up to one land per turn to be sacrificed. If you have more than one, each will do this.

name: Diamond Kaleidoscope
oracle_text: {3}, {T}: Create a 0/1 colorless Prism artifact creature token.
Sacrifice a Prism token: Add one mana of any color.
flavor_text:
"A pretty toy. Now show me its tactical applications."
—Telim'Tor

name: Dormant Volcano
oracle_text: Dormant Volcano enters the battlefield tapped.
When Dormant Volcano enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return an untapped Mountain you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {C}{R}.

rulings.text: This has a triggered ability when it enters the battlefield, not a replacement effect, as previously worded.

name: Dragon Mask
oracle_text: {3}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Return it to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)
flavor_text:
"With no further options, I was forced to don the mask."
—Rashida Scalebane

name: Dream Tides
oracle_text: Creatures don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.

At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may choose any number of tapped nongreen creatures they control and pay {2} for each creature chosen this way. If the player does, untap those creatures.

rulings.text: You can only untap nongreen creatures once, since this has a beginning of upkeep triggered ability.

name: Dwarven Vigilantes
oracle_text: Whenever Dwarven Vigilantes attacks and isn't blocked, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature. If you do, Dwarven Vigilantes assigns no combat damage this turn.
flavor_text: Some dwarves can only be pushed so far.

rulings.text: An ability that triggers when something “attacks and isn’t blocked” triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

name: Elephant Grass
oracle_text: Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Black creatures can't attack you.
Nonblack creatures can't attack you unless their controller pays {2} for each creature they control that's attacking you.
flavor_text:
"How have I angered nature that she would imprison me in a labyrinth of grass?"
—Kasib ibn Naji, Letters

rulings.text: Unless some effect explicitly says otherwise, a creature that can’t attack you can still attack a planeswalker you control.

name: Elkin Lair
oracle_text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player exiles a card at random from their hand. The player may play that card this turn. At the beginning of the next end step, if the player hasn't played the card, they put it into their graveyard.

rulings.text: You can play the card this turn, not just during the resolution of the ability.

This has the supertype world. When a world permanent enters the battlefield, any world permanents that were already on the battlefield are put into their owners’ graveyards. This is a state-based action called the “world rule.” The new world permanent stays on the battlefield. If two world permanents enter the battlefield at the same time, they’re both put into their owners’ graveyards.

name: Elven Cache
oracle_text: Return target card from your graveyard to your hand.
flavor_text:
"The elves can hide better than most can look."
—Mwani, Mtenda herder

name: Emerald Charm
oracle_text: Choose one —
• Untap target permanent.
• Destroy target non-Aura enchantment.
• Target creature loses flying until end of turn.

name: Equipoise
oracle_text: At the beginning of your upkeep, for each land target player controls in excess of the number you control, choose a land that player controls, then the chosen permanents phase out. Repeat this process for artifacts and creatures. (While they're phased out, they're treated as though they don't exist. They phase in before that player untaps during their next untap step.)

rulings.text: In multiplayer games, you can choose a different target player each turn. You can even choose yourself.

You perform the selection and phasing out on lands first, then on artifacts, then on creatures. This means that if you choose an artifact creature during the second pass, your opponent will control one fewer creature when it comes time to perform the third pass.

name: Everglades
oracle_text: Everglades enters the battlefield tapped.
When Everglades enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return an untapped Swamp you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {C}{B}.

rulings.text: This has a triggered ability when it enters the battlefield, not a replacement effect, as previously worded.

name: Eye of Singularity
oracle_text: When Eye of Singularity enters the battlefield, destroy each permanent with the same name as another permanent, except for basic lands. They can't be regenerated.
Whenever a permanent other than a basic land enters the battlefield, destroy all other permanents with that name. They can't be regenerated.

rulings.text: If a copy card enters the battlefield, the permanent it is copying is destroyed and the copy card stays on the battlefield.
Since phasing in does not cause enters-the-battlefield ability to trigger, it is possible to phase in a card which is already on the battlefield and not trigger this effect.

This has the supertype world. When a world permanent enters the battlefield, any world permanents that were already on the battlefield are put into their owners’ graveyards. This is a state-based action called the “world rule.” The new world permanent stays on the battlefield. If two world permanents enter the battlefield at the same time, they’re both put into their owners’ graveyards.

name: Fallen Askari
oracle_text: Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
Fallen Askari can't block.
flavor_text: In troubled times, there are few greater sorrows than a wayward savior.

name: Femeref Enchantress
oracle_text: Whenever an enchantment is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, draw a card.
flavor_text:
"Then she spread a fine dust over the land, like a butterfly shaking its wing."
—"The Enchantress," Femeref tale

rulings.text: If it goes to the graveyard, its ability will not trigger because of any Auras on herself unless those Auras are being destroyed by the same effect that is destroying the Enchantress. This is because those Auras are not put into the graveyard until after she is in the graveyard.

name: Feral Instinct
oracle_text: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
flavor_text:
"If a rhino's head is lower than its shoulders, trust me—it is not praying."
—Mwani, Mtenda herder

name: Fireblast
oracle_text: You may sacrifice two Mountains rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Fireblast deals 4 damage to any target.
flavor_text: Embermages aren't well known for their diplomatic skills.

name: Firestorm Hellkite
oracle_text: Flying, trample
Cumulative upkeep {U}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
flavor_text:
"If it can scar the sky with fire, do not share its destination."
—Mwani, Mtenda herder

rulings.text: Paying cumulative upkeep is always optional. If it’s not paid, the permanent with cumulative upkeep is sacrificed. Partial payments of the total cumulative upkeep cost can’t be made. For example, if a permanent with “cumulative upkeep {1}” has three age counters on it when its cumulative upkeep ability triggers, it gets another age counter and then its controller chooses to either pay {4} or sacrifice the permanent.

name: Flooded Shoreline
oracle_text: {U}{U}, Return two Islands you control to their owner's hand: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
flavor_text:
"Some say the sea is jealous of the land and wishes to climb its heights to meet the sky."
—Afari, Tales

name: Forbidden Ritual
oracle_text: Sacrifice a nontoken permanent. If you do, target opponent loses 2 life unless that player sacrifices a permanent or discards a card. You may repeat this process any number of times.

rulings.text: If you choose to repeat the process, you repeat the effect but do not get to pick a different target opponent.
You choose the target opponent on casting.
You sacrifice during resolution, not during casting.

name: Foreshadow
oracle_text: Choose a card name, then target opponent mills a card. If a card with the chosen name was milled this way, you draw a card.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

rulings.text: You name the card on resolution.

name: Freewind Falcon
oracle_text: Flying, protection from red
flavor_text:
"That does it! I'm going back to hunting chickens!"
—Rhirhok, goblin archer

name: Funeral Charm
oracle_text: Choose one —
• Target player discards a card.
• Target creature gets +2/-1 until end of turn.
• Target creature gains swampwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

name: Giant Caterpillar
oracle_text: {G}, Sacrifice Giant Caterpillar: Create a 1/1 green Insect creature token with flying named Butterfly at the beginning of the next end step.
flavor_text:
"‘I've seen hornworms big as a man's fist,' the traveler said, and nodded soberly when our jaws went slack at his ignorance."
—Afari, Tales

rulings.text: It used to make Butterfly tokens. Now it makes Insect tokens named Butterfly.

name: Goblin Recruiter
oracle_text: When Goblin Recruiter enters the battlefield, search your library for any number of Goblin cards and reveal those cards. Shuffle your library, then put them on top of it in any order.
flavor_text: "Next!"

rulings.text: You can search for any card with the creature type Goblin, including Creature or Tribal cards. Older cards of type “Summon Goblin” and “Summon Goblins” also count. You can’t search for cards that have Goblin in the name but don’t have the creature type Goblin.

name: Goblin Swine-Rider
oracle_text: Whenever Goblin Swine-Rider becomes blocked, it deals 2 damage to each attacking creature and each blocking creature.
flavor_text:
"May you get the mount you deserve."
—Suq'Ata curse

name: Gossamer Chains
oracle_text: Return Gossamer Chains to its owner's hand: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt by target unblocked creature this turn.
flavor_text:
"Harah swung his sword mightily, but still the air held him fast."
—Azeworai, "Kenechi's Dream"

rulings.text: The return of this card to your hand is part of the activation cost and is paid on activation. You do not have a choice to pay this cost zero times or more than one time in order to multiply the effect.
A creature is only considered an “unblocked creature” if it is an attacker during combat after blockers are declared.

name: Griffin Canyon
oracle_text: {T}: Add {C}.
{T}: Untap target Griffin. If it's a creature, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"Where are falling feathers deadlier than falling rock?"
—The One Thousand Questions

rulings.text: This can target an already untapped Griffin, and gives the bonus regardless.

name: Guiding Spirit
oracle_text: Flying
{T}: If the top card of target player's graveyard is a creature card, put that card on top of that player's library.
flavor_text:
"Retainer of eternal Sun! Life flash again upon thy wings."
—"Song to the Sun," Femeref song

name: Hearth Charm
oracle_text: Choose one —
• Destroy target artifact creature.
• Attacking creatures get +1/+0 until end of turn.
• Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.

name: Heat Wave
oracle_text: Cumulative upkeep {R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
Blue creatures can't block creatures you control.
Nonblue creatures can't block creatures you control unless their controller pays 1 life for each blocking creature they control.

name: Helm of Awakening
oracle_text: Spells cost {1} less to cast.
flavor_text:
"This little prize will cover your head, your spells, your bets, and your behind!"
—Pashad ibn Asim, Suq'Ata trader

rulings.text: The generic X cost is still considered generic even if there is a requirement that a specific color be used for it. For example, “only black mana can be spent this way”. This distinction is important for effects which reduce the generic portion of a spell’s cost.
This can lower the cost to zero, but not below zero.
The effect is cumulative.
The lower cost is not optional like with some other cost reducers.
Can never affect the colored part of the cost.
If this card is sacrificed to pay part of a spell’s cost, the cost reduction still applies.

name: Honorable Passage
oracle_text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to any target this turn, prevent that damage. If damage from a red source is prevented this way, Honorable Passage deals that much damage to the source's controller.

name: Hope Charm
oracle_text: Choose one —
• Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
• Target player gains 2 life.
• Destroy target Aura.

name: Hulking Cyclops
oracle_text: Hulking Cyclops can't block.
flavor_text:
"Some say a great cyclops turns the world in its hands, looking down upon it with its one bright eye."
—Afari, Tales

name: Impulse
oracle_text: Look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
flavor_text:
"Controlling time ensures you need never look impulsive again."
—Teferi

rulings.text: This is not a draw.
Due to errata, you no longer shuffle your library.

name: Infantry Veteran
oracle_text: {T}: Target attacking creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"The true dishonor for a soldier is surviving the war."
—Telim'Tor

rulings.text: An “attacking creature” is one that has been declared as an attacker this combat, or one that was put onto the battlefield attacking this combat. Unless that creature leaves combat, it continues to be an attacking creature through the end of combat step, even if the player it was attacking has left the game, or the planeswalker it was attacking has left combat.

name: Infernal Harvest
oracle_text: As an additional cost to cast this spell, return X Swamps you control to their owner's hand.
Infernal Harvest deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures.
flavor_text:
"I offered you eternal life; I just didn't say where."
—Shauku, Endbringer

rulings.text: The return of X of your Swamps to your hand is part of the cost and is paid on casting. You do not have a choice to pay this cost zero times or more than one time in order to multiply the effect.
You can use X as being zero.
If X is 0, you can’t choose any targets.

name: Inspiration
oracle_text: Target player draws two cards.
flavor_text:
"Madness and genius are separated only by degrees of success."
—Sidar Jabari

name: Iron-Heart Chimera
oracle_text: Vigilance
Sacrifice Iron-Heart Chimera: Put a +2/+2 counter on target Chimera creature. It gains vigilance. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

name: Jamuraan Lion
oracle_text: {W}, {T}: Target creature can't block this turn.
flavor_text:
The lion blinked
—Femeref expression meaning "situation avoided"

name: Juju Bubble
oracle_text: Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
When you play a card, sacrifice Juju Bubble.
{2}: You gain 1 life.
flavor_text:
"If my heart had a lid, I would lift it and show you my joy."
—From Suq'Ata wedding ceremony

rulings.text: It does not matter if the card is played from your hand or from somewhere else.

name: Jungle Basin
oracle_text: Jungle Basin enters the battlefield tapped.
When Jungle Basin enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return an untapped Forest you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {C}{G}.

rulings.text: This has a triggered ability when it enters the battlefield, not a replacement effect, as previously worded.

name: Kaervek's Spite
oracle_text: As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice all permanents you control and discard your hand.
Target player loses 5 life.
flavor_text:
"The end justifies the means. What do I care if I rule over the dead rather than over the living? The dead ask fewer questions."
—Kaervek

rulings.text: The sacrifice of all your permanents and discarding of your hand is part of the cost and is paid on casting. You do not have a choice to pay this cost zero times or more than one time in order to multiply the effect.
As always, you can’t sacrifice things you do not control.

name: Karoo
oracle_text: Karoo enters the battlefield tapped.
When Karoo enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return an untapped Plains you control to its owner's hand.
{T}: Add {C}{W}.

rulings.text: This has a triggered ability when it enters the battlefield, not a replacement effect, as previously worded.

name: Katabatic Winds
oracle_text: Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
Creatures with flying can't attack or block, and their activated abilities with {T} in their costs can't be activated.
flavor_text: Wind will win, whatever we wish.

rulings.text: Activated abilities contain a colon. They’re generally written “[Cost]: [Effect].” Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

name: Keeper of Kookus
oracle_text: {R}: Keeper of Kookus gains protection from red until end of turn.
flavor_text: Wanted: Thick-skinned goblin for guarding mean ol' Kookus. Must like fires. Must heal quickly.

name: King Cheetah
oracle_text: Flash
flavor_text:
If you find yourself and a friend being chased by a King Cheetah, you have but one chance: Trip your friend.
—Suq'Ata wisdom

rulings.text: King Cheetah is always a Creature spell, never an instant, regardless of when you cast it.

name: Knight of the Mists
oracle_text: Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
When Knight of the Mists enters the battlefield, you may pay {U}. If you don't, destroy target Knight and it can't be regenerated.
flavor_text: Fear the mists, for they are armed.

rulings.text: If no other Knights are on the battlefield, pay the mana or destroy this card.
Can destroy an opponent’s knight.

name: Knight of Valor
oracle_text: Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
{1}{W}: Each creature without flanking blocking Knight of Valor gets -1/-1 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

rulings.text: The second ability is not Flanking and is not removed by an effect that removes Flanking.

name: Kookus
oracle_text: Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, if you don't control a creature named Keeper of Kookus, Kookus deals 3 damage to you and attacks this turn if able.
{R}: Kookus gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

name: Kyscu Drake
oracle_text: Flying
{G}: Kyscu Drake gets +0/+1 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
Sacrifice Kyscu Drake and a creature named Spitting Drake: Search your library for a card named Viashivan Dragon and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the “search” requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don’t have to find the card if you don’t want to.

name: Lead-Belly Chimera
oracle_text: Trample
Sacrifice Lead-Belly Chimera: Put a +2/+2 counter on target Chimera creature. It gains trample. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

name: Lichenthrope
oracle_text: If damage would be dealt to Lichenthrope, put that many -1/-1 counters on it instead.
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a -1/-1 counter from Lichenthrope.

rulings.text: This card’s effect replaces damage with placement of -1/-1 counters, so side-effects of damage to it will not trigger.

name: Lightning Cloud
oracle_text: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may pay {R}. If you do, Lightning Cloud deals 1 damage to any target.
flavor_text:
The mightiest clouds sit upon spires of fire.
—Femeref adage

rulings.text: Triggers when the spell is cast.
You pick the target when putting the triggered ability on the stack, but you don’t choose whether or not to pay {R} until the triggered ability resolves.

name: Longbow Archer
oracle_text: First strike; reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
flavor_text:
"If it bears wings, I will put it to the skies over Tefemburu."
—Ruya, Zhalfirin archer

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

name: Magma Mine
oracle_text: {4}: Put a pressure counter on Magma Mine.
{T}, Sacrifice Magma Mine: It deals damage equal to the number of pressure counters on it to any target.
flavor_text: BOOM!

name: Man-o'-War
oracle_text: When Man-o'-War enters the battlefield, return target creature to its owner's hand.
flavor_text:
"Beauty to the eye does not always translate to the touch."
—Naimah, Femeref philosopher

rulings.text: If there are no other creatures on the battlefield when Man-o’-War enters the battlefield, its ability must target itself.

name: Matopi Golem
oracle_text: {1}: Regenerate Matopi Golem. When it regenerates this way, put a -1/-1 counter on it.
flavor_text: Some potmakers claim to use the mud of such creatures to make their finest bowls—and that the bowls scream when fired.

name: Miraculous Recovery
oracle_text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Put a +1/+1 counter on it.
flavor_text:
"You stop breathing for just a few minutes and everyone jumps to conclusions."
—Zarkuu, necrosavant

rulings.text: The creature returns to the battlefield without a +1/+1 counter on it. Any abilities that trigger when a creature enters the battlefield will trigger or not as appropriate before it receives the +1/+1 counter and resolve after it has received that counter.
No player may take actions between the time the creature returns to the battlefield and the time you put a +1/+1 counter on it.

name: Mob Mentality
oracle_text: Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has trample.
Whenever all non-Wall creatures you control attack, enchanted creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of attacking creatures.
flavor_text:
"Why is loud stupidity so infectious?"
—Rana, Suq'Ata market fool

name: Mortal Wound
oracle_text: Enchant creature
When enchanted creature is dealt damage, destroy it.
flavor_text:
"Their tears spill over Jamuraa. Mixed with blood, they wash everything red."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Mundungu
oracle_text: {T}: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1} and 1 life.
flavor_text:
"Our buried kings silently await the revolt of dead peasants."
—Tuwile, mundungu of Aku

name: Mystic Veil
oracle_text: You may cast Mystic Veil as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step.
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
flavor_text:
"Magic is my thread, my will the needle. I weave over you as if you never were."
—Poetics of Hanan

rulings.text: Does not destroy Auras which are already on the creature.
The sacrifice occurs only if you cast it using its own ability. If you cast it using some other effect (for instance, if it gained flash from Vedalken Orrery), then it won’t be sacrificed.

name: Natural Order
oracle_text: As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a green creature.
Search your library for a green creature card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
flavor_text: . . . but the price of Mangara's freedom was Asmira's life.

rulings.text: Sacrificing a green creature is part of Natural Order’s cost. You can’t sacrifice more creatures to search for more creature cards, and you can’t cast Natural Order at all if you control no green creatures.

Players can respond to this spell only after it’s been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to stop you from casting this spell or to make you sacrifice a different one.

name: Necromancy
oracle_text: You may cast Necromancy as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step.

When Necromancy enters the battlefield, if it's on the battlefield, it becomes an Aura with "enchant creature put onto the battlefield with Necromancy." Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control and attach Necromancy to it. When Necromancy leaves the battlefield, that creature's controller sacrifices it.

rulings.text: The bringing of the creature onto the battlefield and then putting Necromancy on it is all done as part of the resolution.
When putting a card onto the battlefield that requires a definition for its value or some other choice, you do what is needed to define the value or make the choice.
Necromancy enters the battlefield as an enchantment and then becomes an Enchant Creature Aura as a triggered ability upon entering the battlefield. It follows all the rules for Auras from then on.

If the creature card put onto the battlefield has protection from black (or anything that prevents this from legally being attached), this won’t be able to attach to it. Then this will go to the graveyard as a state-based action, causing the creature to be sacrificed.
The sacrifice occurs only if you cast it using its own ability. If you cast it using some other effect (for instance, if it gained flash from Vedalken Orrery), then it won’t be sacrificed.

name: Necrosavant
oracle_text: {3}{B}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Return Necrosavant from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
flavor_text:
"Ah, I remember my first death."
—Zarkuu, necrosavant

rulings.text: The ability is activated while this card is in the graveyard.

name: Nekrataal
oracle_text: First strike
When Nekrataal enters the battlefield, destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. That creature can't be regenerated.
flavor_text:
"I have seen the horrors Kaervek has freed. My betrayal is certain—but of Kaervek or of Jamuraa, I cannot say."
—Jolrael

rulings.text: Nothing happens if there are no nonartifact, nonblack creatures on the battlefield when Nekrataal enters the battlefield, but if there is one, you must target it, even if it’s a creature you control.

name: Ogre Enforcer
oracle_text: Ogre Enforcer can't be destroyed by lethal damage unless lethal damage dealt by a single source is marked on it.
flavor_text:
"Ate up all of his siblings in the first week. A good beginning for one destined to command."
—Suka, ogre matron

rulings.text: If its toughness falls to zero or less and it is undamaged, it will still be put into the graveyard.
The check for nonlethal damage is done on a per-source basis. So each source’s damage is checked independently and it is not possible to team up sources (such as creatures) in order to kill it.

name: Ovinomancer
oracle_text: When Ovinomancer enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return three basic lands you control to their owner's hand.
{T}, Return Ovinomancer to its owner's hand: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. That creature's controller creates a 0/1 green Sheep creature token.

rulings.text: Can target itself. This will cause it to be returned to your hand during announcement and will result in no sheep since it will not be on the battlefield at resolution so the effect fails since it target is illegal.

name: Panther Warriors
flavor_text:
"When you run you're graceful and swift, sleek as a powerful panther."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Parapet
oracle_text: You may cast Parapet as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step.
Creatures you control get +0/+1.
flavor_text: There is no wall that can't be improved by making it taller.

rulings.text: The sacrifice occurs only if you cast it using its own ability. If you cast it using some other effect (for instance, if it gained flash from Vedalken Orrery), then it won’t be sacrificed.

name: Peace Talks
oracle_text: This turn and next turn, creatures can't attack, and players and permanents can't be the targets of spells or activated abilities.
flavor_text:
"By the tongues of a thousand serpents, this time I do not lie."
—Ahmahz il Kin, Suq'Ata diplomat

rulings.text: Can be cast after your attack.

It affects the current turn and the next turn. This could affect the same player twice if they have two turns in a row, or it could affect different players. In a multiplayer game it affects exactly two turns, not a full round of turns.
Doesn’t skip the Combat Phase, just renders creatures unable to attack.
Activated abilities contain a colon. They’re generally written “[Cost]: [Effect].” Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

name: Phyrexian Marauder
oracle_text: Phyrexian Marauder enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
Phyrexian Marauder can't block.
Phyrexian Marauder can't attack unless you pay {1} for each +1/+1 counter on it.

name: Phyrexian Walker
flavor_text:
"I have heard terrible tales of black rains, ashen fields, and metal that screams. I have consoled myself that the tales were a myth of some fevered mind. But today I saw a walker—and now I fear the truth."
—Kasib Ibn Naji, Letters

name: Pillar Tombs of Aku
oracle_text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may sacrifice a creature. If that player doesn't, they lose 5 life and you sacrifice Pillar Tombs of Aku.
flavor_text:
"Aku, City of Hidden Graves / Aku, City of Lost Kings / Aku, welcome me."
—Pillar tomb inscription

rulings.text: This has the supertype world. When a world permanent enters the battlefield, any world permanents that were already on the battlefield are put into their owners’ graveyards. This is a state-based action called the “world rule.” The new world permanent stays on the battlefield. If two world permanents enter the battlefield at the same time, they’re both put into their owners’ graveyards.

name: Prosperity
oracle_text: Each player draws X cards.
flavor_text:
"Wealth is a good thing, compared to poverty—your food is better, your robes are softer, and your companions have bathed more recently."
—Kipkemboi, Kukemssa pirate

rulings.text: If both players run out of cards during this effect, the game is a draw.

name: Pygmy Hippo
oracle_text: Whenever Pygmy Hippo attacks and isn't blocked, you may have defending player activate a mana ability of each land they control and lose all unspent mana. If you do, Pygmy Hippo assigns no combat damage this turn and at the beginning of your next main phase this turn, you add an amount of {C} equal to the amount of mana that player lost this way.

rulings.text: A mana ability is an ability that (1) isn’t a loyalty ability, (2) doesn’t target, and (3) could put mana into a player’s mana pool when it resolves.

An ability that triggers when something “attacks and isn’t blocked” triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

name: Python
flavor_text:
"How can you claim the gods are merciless when they robbed the snake of its limbs to give the other creatures a sporting chance?"
—Hakim, Loreweaver

name: Quicksand
oracle_text: {T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Sacrifice Quicksand: Target attacking creature without flying gets -1/-2 until end of turn.

name: Quirion Druid
oracle_text: {G}, {T}: Target land becomes a 2/2 green creature that's still a land. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
flavor_text:
"The land has been gracious enough to let you tread upon her for years. That privilege is about to end."
—Liefellen, Quirion exarch

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn’t matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

name: Quirion Ranger
oracle_text: Return a Forest you control to its owner's hand: Untap target creature. Activate this ability only once each turn.
flavor_text:
"Respect the earth, for it will one day be your shield and another day your blanket."
—Liefellen, Quirion exarch

rulings.text: It can target an untapped creature.

name: Raging Gorilla
oracle_text: Whenever Raging Gorilla blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/-2 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"Every temper tantrum makes another angry gorilla."
—Femeref children's myth

name: Rainbow Efreet
oracle_text: Flying
{U}{U}: Rainbow Efreet phases out. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before you untap during your next untap step.)
flavor_text:
"A beauty made more so by its fleeting visitations."
—Teferi

name: Relentless Assault
oracle_text: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
flavor_text:
"Flog and Squee / Up the tree / See the army / Flee, flee, flee."
—Goblin nursery rhyme/war cry

rulings.text: If you manage to cast this during a main phase of your opponent’s turn, that opponent’s creatures will untap and that opponent will be able to attack again. It will not allow you to attack during their turn.
Abilities that trigger when a creature attacks, blocks, or is blocked will trigger during each combat that turn. Thus, a creature with Rampage will get the bonus added during each attack.
A creature that must attack each turn, must only attack once that turn. It is not forced into each attack that turn.
It only creates an additional combat and main phase if it resolves during a main phase.

name: Relic Ward
oracle_text: You may cast Relic Ward as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step.
Enchant artifact
Enchanted artifact has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
flavor_text: Asmira's prayers alone should have freed Mangara from the amber prison . . .

rulings.text: Does not destroy Auras which are on the artifact, and it does not prevent Auras from being moved onto the artifact.
The sacrifice occurs only if you cast it using its own ability. If you cast it using some other effect (for instance, if it gained flash from Vedalken Orrery), then it won’t be sacrificed.

name: Remedy
oracle_text: Prevent the next 5 damage that would be dealt this turn to any number of targets, divided as you choose.
flavor_text:
"These things will protect you while I'm gone, remind you of my love for you."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

rulings.text: You choose the targets and you choose how to divide up the 5 damage on announcement.

name: Resistance Fighter
oracle_text: Sacrifice Resistance Fighter: Prevent all combat damage target creature would deal this turn.
flavor_text:
"My soldiers fought without hesitation, died without doubt."
—Sidar Jabari

name: Retribution of the Meek
oracle_text: Destroy all creatures with power 4 or greater. They can't be regenerated.
flavor_text:
"Tread upon the meek, and they shall wound your feet and make you crawl."
—Asmira, Holy Avenger

name: Righteous Aura
oracle_text: {W}, Pay 2 life: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
flavor_text:
"Good is not a ‘thing.' You can neither touch nor own it. No, Good is a vision we all share and strive to make real."
—Asmira, Holy Avenger

name: Righteous War
oracle_text: White creatures you control have protection from black.
Black creatures you control have protection from white.
flavor_text:
"This is a war without neutrality."
—Asmira, Holy Avenger

name: River Boa
oracle_text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
{G}: Regenerate River Boa.
flavor_text:
"But no one heard the snake's gentle hiss for peace over the elephant's trumpeting of war."
—Afari, Tales

name: Rock Slide
oracle_text: Rock Slide deals X damage divided as you choose among any number of target attacking or blocking creatures without flying.
flavor_text:
"Good ol' rock. Nothing beats rock."
—Rhirhok, goblin archer

rulings.text: If X is 0, you can’t choose any targets.

name: Rowen
oracle_text: Reveal the first card you draw each turn. Whenever you reveal a basic land card this way, draw a card.
flavor_text:
"I've dreamt of a second harvest but fear I will not see it."
—Asmira, Holy Avenger

rulings.text: The first sentence is a continuous ability. You reveal the card when you draw it, during the resolution of any draw effect. The second sentence is a triggered ability, and thus will wait until the entire draw effect finishes resolving before you do it.

name: Sands of Time
oracle_text: Each player skips their untap step.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player simultaneously untaps each tapped artifact, creature, and land they control and taps each untapped artifact, creature, and land they control.
flavor_text:
"But once, with a magician's help, Time was stopped and Day stood still."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

rulings.text: This card still affects players when it is tapped.
Skipping the untap step means that phased out cards won’t phase in, and permanents with phasing won’t phase out.

You can tap lands for mana before Sands of Time toggles your permanents. The mana you gain is in your mana pool during your upkeep step, but will disappear before your draw step if you don’t spend it. You cannot save it to be spent on the card you will draw this turn.

name: Scalebane's Elite
oracle_text: Protection from black
flavor_text:
"With Rashida's blades, my guiding vision and the luck of the blessed, today we will free Mangara!"
—Asmira, Holy Avenger

name: Shimmering Efreet
oracle_text: Flying
Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
Whenever Shimmering Efreet phases in, target creature phases out. (It phases in before its controller untaps during their next untap step.)
flavor_text:
Life or death: which is the illusion?"
—Naimah, Femeref philosopher

rulings.text: If it phases in and no other creatures are on the battlefield, it will phase itself back out.
If two of these phase in, they can both target the same creature and have just that one creature phase out.

name: Shrieking Drake
oracle_text: Flying
When Shrieking Drake enters the battlefield, return a creature you control to its owner's hand.
flavor_text:
"Kaervek believes the drakes' cries herald his victory; in truth, they mourn aloud for his impending demise."
—Teferi

rulings.text: You choose the creature to return on resolution of the triggered ability. This is not targeted.

name: Simoon
oracle_text: Simoon deals 1 damage to each creature target opponent controls.
flavor_text:
"The black-and-white sacred monkey holds her children to her, and waits."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

name: Sisay's Ring
oracle_text: {T}: Add {C}{C}.
flavor_text:
"With this ring, you have friends in worlds you've never heard of."
—Sisay, Captain of the Weatherlight

name: Snake Basket
oracle_text: {X}, Sacrifice Snake Basket: Create X 1/1 green Snake creature tokens. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
flavor_text:
"Uh, does anyone have a flute?"
—Rana, Suq'Ata market fool

rulings.text: It used to make Cobra tokens. Now it makes Snake tokens.

name: Solfatara
oracle_text: Target player can't play lands this turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
flavor_text:
"A burst of hot air tossed the moon into the air, and the moon liked it up there so much it never needed the ground again."
—Azeworai, "Glitter Moon"

rulings.text: Prevents all land playing that turn, not just one land.
Does not prevent effects from putting a land onto the battlefield.

name: Song of Blood
oracle_text: Mill four cards. Whenever a creature attacks this turn, it gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each creature card put into your graveyard this way.
flavor_text: Purraj sang slaughter and danced death.

rulings.text: If a creature attacks more than once in a turn, it gets the bonus each time.

name: Spider Climb
oracle_text: You may cast Spider Climb as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step.
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+3 and has reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)

rulings.text: The sacrifice occurs only if you cast it using its own ability. If you cast it using some other effect (for instance, if it gained flash from Vedalken Orrery), then it won’t be sacrificed.

name: Spitting Drake
oracle_text: Flying
{R}: Spitting Drake gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
flavor_text: It prefers its meals cooked.

name: Squandered Resources
oracle_text: Sacrifice a land: Add one mana of any type the sacrificed land could produce.
flavor_text:
"He traded sand for skins, skins for gold, gold for life. In the end, he traded life for sand."
—Afari, Tales

rulings.text: Can sacrifice a land which can’t produce mana, but you don’t get any mana from this ability.

name: Stampeding Wildebeests
oracle_text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, return a green creature you control to its owner's hand.
flavor_text: Prayers for rain are answered with the thunder of hooves.

rulings.text: The ability that returns a creature doesn’t target anything. You can return a creature with shroud or protection from green, for example. You don’t decide which creature to return until the ability resolves. If you control no other green creatures, you must return Stampeding Wildebeests itself.
You choose a creature and return it all during resolution of the triggered ability. This means that if you have two Wildebeests, there is no way to end up returning only one creature.

name: Suleiman's Legacy
oracle_text: When Suleiman's Legacy enters the battlefield, destroy all Djinns and Efreets. They can't be regenerated.
Whenever a Djinn or Efreet enters the battlefield, destroy it. It can't be regenerated.
flavor_text: With Suleiman's ascension to power, the djinn and efreets of ancient Rabiah learned humility.

rulings.text: Does nothing to Djinns or Efreets that phase in while it is on the battlefield.

name: Summer Bloom
oracle_text: You may play up to three additional lands this turn.
flavor_text:
"Our love is like the river in the summer season of long rains. / For a little while it spilled its banks, flooding the crops in the fields."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

rulings.text: This spell increases the number of lands you can play in a turn. The land cards are played as you would normally play lands.

name: Sun Clasp
oracle_text: Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+3.
{W}: Return enchanted creature to its owner's hand.
flavor_text:
"And darkness shall be cast from me
For my soul resides in the Sun."
—Femeref dirge

name: Suq'Ata Assassin
oracle_text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Whenever Suq'Ata Assassin attacks and isn't blocked, defending player gets a poison counter. (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)

rulings.text: An ability that triggers when something “attacks and isn’t blocked” triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

name: Suq'Ata Lancer
oracle_text: Haste
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
flavor_text:
"Never stop 'til you see your lance come out the other side."
—Telim'Tor

name: Talruum Champion
oracle_text: First strike
Whenever Talruum Champion blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, that creature loses first strike until end of turn.
flavor_text: In the Talruum language, there is no word for "surprised."

name: Talruum Piper
oracle_text: All creatures with flying able to block Talruum Piper do so.
flavor_text: When the Talruum began to play, the dragons fell from the sky to squash the obnoxious noise.

name: Tar Pit Warrior
oracle_text: When Tar Pit Warrior becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.
flavor_text:
"The cyclops shrugged off savage blows, but casual insults made him weep."
—Azeworai, "The Cyclops who Couldn't"

name: Teferi's Honor Guard
oracle_text: Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
{U}{U}: Teferi's Honor Guard phases out. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before you untap during your next untap step.)
flavor_text:
"They may seem ceremonial, but their swords are still sharp."
—Kipkemboi, Kukemssa pirate

name: Teferi's Puzzle Box
oracle_text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player puts the cards in their hand on the bottom of their library in any order, then draws that many cards.

rulings.text: You do your normal draw before this ability is put on the stack.
If you have more than one of these, each effect triggers separately.

name: Teferi's Realm
oracle_text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player chooses artifact, creature, land, or non-Aura enchantment. All nontoken permanents of that type phase out. (While they're phased out, they're treated as though they don't exist. Each one phases in before its controller untaps during their next untap step.)
flavor_text:
"Fire is dead. Water has killed him."
—From The Stories of Nature

rulings.text: Does not affect token permanents, only cards.
Can affect itself if you choose “non-Aura enchantment”.

This has the supertype world. When a world permanent enters the battlefield, any world permanents that were already on the battlefield are put into their owners’ graveyards. This is a state-based action called the “world rule.” The new world permanent stays on the battlefield. If two world permanents enter the battlefield at the same time, they’re both put into their owners’ graveyards.

name: Tempest Drake
oracle_text: Flying, vigilance
flavor_text:
"Its speed will be equaled only by the swiftness of my enemy's fall."
—Kaervek

name: Three Wishes
oracle_text: Exile the top three cards of your library face down. You may look at those cards for as long as they remain exiled. Until your next turn, you may play those cards. At the beginning of your next upkeep, put any of those cards you didn't play into your graveyard.

rulings.text: You can look at the three exiled cards at any time.
You can only play them before the start of your upkeep. Between the start of your upkeep and putting the extra cards into the graveyard, you can’t play them.
To “play a card” is to either cast a spell or to put a land onto the battlefield using the main phase special action.

name: Time and Tide
oracle_text: Simultaneously, all phased-out creatures phase in and all creatures with phasing phase out.
flavor_text:
"Time may heal all wounds, but what heals time?"
—Teferi

name: Tin-Wing Chimera
oracle_text: Flying
Sacrifice Tin-Wing Chimera: Put a +2/+2 counter on target Chimera creature. It gains flying. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

name: Tithe
oracle_text: Search your library for a Plains card. If target opponent controls more lands than you, you may search your library for an additional Plains card. Reveal those cards and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Counts lands on resolution, not on announcement.
Because the “search” requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don’t have to find the card if you don’t want to.

name: Tremor
oracle_text: Tremor deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
flavor_text:
"Where do you run when the earth becomes your enemy?"
—Naimah, Femeref philosopher

name: Triangle of War
oracle_text: {2}, Sacrifice Triangle of War: Target creature you control fights target creature an opponent controls. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)
flavor_text: The Zhalfirin war triangle represents a trinity of might, faith, and guile.

rulings.text: If either target is illegal when the ability resolves, it will do nothing.

name: Uktabi Orangutan
oracle_text: When Uktabi Orangutan enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact.
flavor_text:
"Is it true that the apes wear furs of gold when they marry?"
—Rana, Suq'Ata market fool

name: Undiscovered Paradise
oracle_text: {T}: Add one mana of any color. During your next untap step, as you untap your permanents, return Undiscovered Paradise to its owner's hand.
flavor_text: Jolrael's choice of homes was far better than her choice of allies.

rulings.text: It will return even if some effect prevents you from untapping it. The ability is not replacing the untapping of the land in any way.
Only returns to owner’s hand if it is still on the battlefield at the beginning of its controller’s next untap.

name: Undo
oracle_text: Return two target creatures to their owners' hands.
flavor_text:
"Oft have I wished to undo past deeds, but never did I imagine they would be undone for me."
—Naimah, Femeref philosopher

rulings.text: The two creatures may have different owners and return to their respective owner’s hands.

name: Urborg Mindsucker
oracle_text: {B}, Sacrifice Urborg Mindsucker: Target opponent discards a card at random. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
flavor_text:
"My pet will pick the ripe fruit from your tortured brain as if it were hanging from a vine."
—Kaervek

rulings.text: If you cast this as normal during your main phase, it will enter the battlefield and you’ll receive priority. If no abilities trigger because of this, you can activate its ability immediately, before any other player has a chance to remove it from the battlefield.

name: Vampiric Tutor
oracle_text: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it. You lose 2 life.
flavor_text:
"I write upon clean white parchment with a sharp quill and the blood of my students, divining their secrets."
—Shauku, Endbringer

rulings.text: The “shuffle and put the card on top” is a single action. If an effect causes the top card of the library to be face up, the second card down is not revealed.

name: Vampirism
oracle_text: Enchant creature
When Vampirism enters the battlefield, draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature you control.
Other creatures you control get -1/-1.

name: Vanishing
oracle_text: Enchant creature
{U}{U}: Enchanted creature phases out. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before its controller untaps during their next untap step.)
flavor_text:
"Careless, like a child with fire, so was I with time."
—Teferi

name: Viashino Sandstalker
oracle_text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
At the beginning of the end step, return Viashino Sandstalker to its owner's hand. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)
flavor_text:
"Some believe Sandstalkers to be illusions; those with scars know better."
—Zhalfirin Guide to the Desert

rulings.text: It is returned to its owner’s hand at the end of any turn in which it is on the battlefield.

name: Viashivan Dragon
oracle_text: Flying
{R}: Viashivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{G}: Viashivan Dragon gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
flavor_text: The Viashivan understand that cruelty arises from opportunity.

name: Vision Charm
oracle_text: Choose one —
• Target player mills four cards.
• Choose a land type and a basic land type. Each land of the first chosen type becomes the second chosen type until end of turn.
• Target artifact phases out. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before its controller untaps during their next untap step.)

rulings.text: All lands changed are changed to the same type.

name: Wake of Vultures
oracle_text: Flying
{1}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate Wake of Vultures.
flavor_text:
"So the vulture said to the griffin, ‘You gonna eat that?'"
—Azeworai, "The Ugly Bird"

rulings.text: You can sacrifice Wake of Vultures to activate its own ability. The ability will have no effect as it resolves.

name: Wand of Denial
oracle_text: {T}: Look at the top card of target player's library. If it's a nonland card, you may pay 2 life. If you do, put it into that player's graveyard.
flavor_text: You'll never miss what you never had.

name: Warrior's Honor
oracle_text: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"We are to be bound together as the reeds of a basket."
—Asmira, Rashida, and Jabari, unity chant

rulings.text: Warrior’s Honor affects creatures you control that are on the battlefield at the time it resolves. If you put a creature onto the battlefield later in the turn, that creature won’t get the bonus.

name: Warthog
oracle_text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
flavor_text:
"Too much work—it takes a long time to break them in, and more than a few recruits."
—Grebog, goblin swine-rider

name: Waterspout Djinn
oracle_text: Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Waterspout Djinn unless you return an untapped Island you control to its owner's hand.
flavor_text:
"Fly us higher, out of its storm."
—Sisay, Captain of the Weatherlight

rulings.text: You choose a land to return and return it during resolution of the upkeep triggered ability. This means if you have two Waterspout Djinns, they must each return different Islands.

name: Wicked Reward
oracle_text: As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Target creature gets +4/+2 until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"The blood on my hands is merely proof of my ambition."
—Kaervek

rulings.text: You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

name: Wind Shear
oracle_text: Attacking creatures with flying get -2/-2 and lose flying until end of turn.
flavor_text:
"As the winds abated, there was a shower of dragonscales, then nothing more."
—Azeworai, "The Unruly Wind"

rulings.text: The -2/-2 and loss of Flying both last until end of turn. The -2/-2 is not permanent.

name: Zhalfirin Crusader
oracle_text: Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
{1}{W}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Zhalfirin Crusader this turn is dealt to any target instead.
flavor_text:
"War is the crucible of leadership."
—Rashida Scalebane
